lexUnit.name: hunger.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a feeling of discomfort or weakness caused by lack of food, coupled with the desire to eat.

sentence.text: The hunger of the coastal sugar-cane workers and their families is constant and chronic .
The hunger of the sertanejos of the backlands is periodic , acute and explosive .
By the time they had eaten up the crumbs they had forgotten the way out and in their hunger ate the insulation from the wiring .
But his hunger turns my creativity , in spite of both of us , into an obligation .

Above me , the gaily painted signs of the taverns and food shops creaked in the wind and mocked my hunger .
L'Alouette is the place to go if you like your food to be high on taste , low on stodge , to demolish your hunger but leave room for your thirst .
On the other hand , her grey eyes were big , and that was usually a sign of hunger .
He felt very frightened , but also desperate with hunger .
A roaring , dripping maw yawned with monstrous hunger .
Researchers at the University of Pennsylvania found a big increase in crankiness and hunger during these growth spurts .
Helen was struck by the hunger in the face .
She sensed that he was holding back with a massive effort , suppressing his own hunger with iron discipline .

Today is World Food Day ; it 's been launched by the United Nations as a reminder of the crisis of poverty and hunger in the developing world .

She wanted Fen Marshall so badly , with a bodily hunger she had never before experienced .

Many people were dying from hunger .
At first I thought I would die of hunger , as I could not eat the Yahoos ' dirty meat or the Houys ' grass and corn .
It is true to say that the only overweight animals are those cared for by humans who take more notice of the time on the clock than of natural feelings of hunger .

A sense of weakness or goneness in the heart region that extends to the stomach creating a sensation of hunger .
